alert.note: Alert for Cameron Island; Kenedy Island; Willacy Island (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued January 07 at 2:42PM CST until January 09 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM CST THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous longshore and rip currents expected. * WHERE...Kenedy Island, Willacy Island and Cameron Island Counties. * WHEN...From 9 PM CST Sunday evening through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Longshore currents can pull swimmers far up or down the beach, well aweay from their entry point. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very strong south to north longshore currents will develop this evening and continue through Monday evening. Currents will quickly turn to a north to south longshore, though possibly at lesser intensity if flow is from west to east, later Monday night into Tuesday. Residual southeasterly swell is likely to make the surf rough and confused even as the direction of the current.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Cameron Island; Kenedy Island; Willacy Island
